input: question: When did the Median tribes unify under a single ruler to form the Median Empire? [SEP] sentence: This marked the end of the Kingdom of Urartu as well, which was subsequently conquered and dissolved.

question: Bell's patent was for the method and what for transmitting vocal and other sounds telegraphically? [SEP] sentence: Bell returned to Boston the same day and the next day resumed work, drawing in his notebook a diagram similar to that in Gray's patent caveat.

question: In what year was Columbia University chartered? [SEP] sentence: The Stamp Act Congress met in New York in October 1765 as the Sons of Liberty organized in the city, skirmishing over the next ten years with British troops stationed there.

question: What is the commonly held notion regarding the dual nature of the soul called? [SEP] sentence: It was thought that each person had a two-part soul: the spirit-soul (hun 魂) which journeyed to the afterlife paradise of immortals (xian), and the body-soul (po 魄) which remained in its grave or tomb on earth and was only reunited with the spirit-soul through a ritual ceremony.

question: Where in Sicily were the "Orpheus," and the "Four Seasons" discovered? [SEP] sentence: Other important examples of Roman mosaic art in Sicily were unearthed on the Piazza Vittoria in Palermo where two houses were discovered.

question: How many subordinate divisions did the National Military Establishment contain? [SEP] sentence: The act created the National Military Establishment (renamed Department of Defense in 1949), which was composed of three subordinate Military Departments, namely the Department of the Army, the Department of the Navy, and the newly created Department of the Air Force.

question: What is appearance a poor indication of? [SEP] sentence: These socioeconomic factors are also significant to the limits of racial lines, because a minority of pardos, or brown people, are likely to start declaring themselves white or black if socially upward, and being seen as relatively "whiter" as their perceived social status increases (much as in other regions of Latin America).

question: Where did Circassians settle to when leaving their homes in the Caucasus? [SEP] sentence: The war caused an exodus of the Crimean Tatars, about 200,000 of whom moved to the Ottoman Empire in continuing waves of emigration.

question: Why did the anti-miscegenation not insure that there was no interracial mixing? [SEP] sentence: White legislators passed laws prohibiting marriage between European and Asian Americans until the 1950s.

question: Water conservation policies have been adopted by what two sectors? [SEP] sentence: The city first proposed its Sustainable City Plan in 1992 and in 1994, was one of the first cities in the nation to formally adopt a comprehensive sustainability plan, setting waste reduction and water conservation policies for both public and private sector through its Office of Sustainability and the Environment.
question: What are Hamburg and Berlin called? [SEP] sentence: Germany is a federal republic consisting of sixteen federal states (German: Bundesland, or Land).[a]

question: What was the high end of the estimated death rate of the Black Plague? [SEP] sentence: By around 1420, the accumulated effect of recurring plagues and famines had reduced the population of Europe to perhaps no more than a third of what it was a century earlier.

question: Where did the Russians try to resist Napoleon and get defeated? [SEP] sentence: The Russians again avoided battle, although in a few cases this was only achieved because Napoleon uncharacteristically hesitated to attack when the opportunity arose.

question: Which historians referred to Iran as Persis? [SEP] sentence: As the most extensive interactions the Ancient Greeks had with any outsider was with the Persians, the term persisted, even long after the Persian rule in Greece.
question: Which British jurist later made the phrase "rule of law" popular in the 1800s? [SEP] sentence: The rule of law was further popularized in the 19th century by British jurist A. V. Dicey.

question: How many times has the University of Arizona men's basketball team won NCAA tournaments? [SEP] sentence: The men's basketball team, formerly coached by Hall of Fame head coach Lute Olson and currently coached by Sean Miller, has made 25 straight NCAA Tournaments and won the 1997 National Championship.
